description: doc/reference-cmd: doc/fmt can be invoked by cmd/go but also available as independent command

messages.text: LGTM Feel free to make these edits and check it in. I suspect I'll do a rewrite; I see a solution. thanks. http://codereview.appspot.com/5877050/diff/7003/doc/reference-cmd.html File doc/reference-cmd.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5877050/diff/7003/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode53 doc/reference-cmd.html:53: as independent godoc command with more general options). s/Go programs/Go packages,/ delete the parens and make what is inside them a separate sentence. s/as/as an/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5877050/diff/7003/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode59 doc/reference-cmd.html:59: Fmt formats Go programs (it is also available as independent Fmt formats the source code of Go packages. It is also available as an independent gofmt command with more general options.

I think it's fine as is. If you read the whole page, it makes sense.

The only thing might be to extend the entries on godoc and gofmt, where are in the list, to explain their two invocation methods. But vet is different as well (go tool vet vs. go vet) and it's probably not worth going into the details here.

I say leave it alone.

I agree there is something wrong here, but I don't know if that is the right fix.  "go doc" and "go fmt" do work.  Perhaps we should s/godoc/goc/ and add a note saying that godoc is also an independent command?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/
I would also be happy with Ian's proposal to change the names in this table as long as it also says they are available, with more general options, as independent commands godoc and gofmt.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, iant@golang.org, r@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
